alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 02 at 7:12PM EDT until May 03 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warnings continues for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Moderate flooding is Forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Hallowell. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water enters the back side of buildings along Water Street. Front Street becomes completely submerged. The parking lot by town dock flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:42 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:42 PM EDT Tuesday was 16.6 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested at around 16.6 feet. It will fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
